func fastPowMod(n: int; k: int; m: int): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculates n ^ k mod m. 
proc getPrime(r: Slice[int]): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Generate prime number inside range r. Use for big enough ranges, like 10e9 .. 10e10. 
proc isPrime(n: int): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Decide whether n is a prime number. Use for big numbers. Firstly uses a table to check for small prime factors, which is considered faster than using the Miller Rabin test at first. 
proc millerRabinTest(n, tests: int): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Uses Miller Rabin Algorithm to test whether n is (probably) a prime number.
